intro: Phoradendron colombianum, commonly known as the Colombian mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on various host trees in the neotropical region. It belongs to the Viscaceae family and has a unique structure with a smooth, waxy surface and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often clustered together. Its berries are typically red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. This species plays an important ecological role in its native habitats by contributing to the biodiversity of the forest canopy.
